title: 1964 Masters Tournament
text:
The 1964 Masters Tournament was the 28th <a href="Masters%20Tournament">Masters Tournament</a>, held April 9–12 at <a href="Augusta%20National%20Golf%20Club">Augusta National Golf Club</a> in <a href="Augusta%2C%20Georgia">Augusta, Georgia</a>. A field of 96 players entered the tournament and 48 made the 36-hole cut at 148 (+4).
<a href="Arnold%20Palmer">Arnold Palmer</a>, age 34, opened with three rounds in the 60s and led by five strokes after 54 holes at 206 (−10). He carded a final round of 70 on Sunday to win by six strokes to become the first four-time winner of the Masters. It was his seventh and final <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> victory. 
<a href="Craig%20Wood%20%28golfer%29">Craig Wood</a>, the <a href="1941%20Masters%20Tournament">1941</a> champion, played in his final Masters, but withdrew before completing the first round. Prior to his win at Augusta, he was the runner-up in the first two Masters in <a href="1934%20Masters%20Tournament">1934</a> and <a href="1935%20Masters%20Tournament">1935</a>.
<a href="Labron%20Harris%20Jr.">Labron Harris Jr.</a> won the <a href="Masters%20Tournament%23Par%203%20Contest">Par 3 contest</a> with a score of 23.
Palmer was later joined as a four-time winner at Augusta by <a href="Jack%20Nicklaus">Jack Nicklaus</a> in <a href="1972%20Masters%20Tournament">1972</a> and <a href="Tiger%20Woods">Tiger Woods</a> in <a href="2005%20Masters%20Tournament">2005</a>; Nicklaus won his fifth in <a href="1975%20Masters%20Tournament">1975</a> and a record sixth in <a href="1986%20Masters%20Tournament">1986</a>.
